result.execSummary:
The defendant Connie J Zimmerman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.  Defendant to submit DNA sample; pay $250 surcharge. Periodic review n six months.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Attorney Brian Severson
Filed by Attorney Brian Severson

Defendant Connie J Zimmerman in court with attorney Brian Severson.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence: 2 yr. probation, conds: Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. $518 costs. Periodic review in six months. No jail credit.
